intro: Tribulus moluccanus, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Africa, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. It is a member of the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Tribulus moluccanus is also noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various health purposes.
